headline: What Yum! Brands (YUM)'s Digital Push, Dividend Hike and Pizza Hut Review Mean For Shareholders
summary: Yum! Brands recently filed its 2025 Form 10-K, detailing past-year operations, expanded digital capabilities via its Byte by Yum! platform, a 6% increase in its quarterly dividend, share repurchases under a US$2.00 billion authorization, and acquisitions including 128 Taco Bell restaurants, alongside plans for a 2026 strategic review of Pizza Hut. On the governance side, long-time director Keith Barr resigned from the board on February 10, 2026, to take an external leadership role, while the...
